definition: Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
(classical) a type of battle-ax/to kill/to slaughter
surname Liu
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: Liu Bei lost no time in telling his brothers the story of King Wen bent on visiting one of his subjects called Jiang Ziya.
sentences.chinese: 劉備忙講了當年文王訪姜子牙的故事。

sentences.english: The victory opened the period of great prosperity for Liubei.
sentences.chinese: 漢中爭奪戰的勝利，開啓了劉備事業的鼎盛時期。

sentences.english: "I will go, " said Liu Bei as soon as he heard the news.
sentences.chinese: “我要走了，”說劉備他一聽到這個消息。

sentences.english: Liu Bei retired calmly, but Zhang Fei was furious.
sentences.chinese: 劉備退休的很平靜，但張飛怒不可遏。

sentences.english: He had to make three visits before Zhuge Liang agreed to do so, impressed by his sincerity.
sentences.chinese: 諸葛亮見劉備十分誠懇，終於答應了他的請求。

sentences.english: Despite being greatly outnumbered, Liu Bei and Sun Quan eventually won the battle.
sentences.chinese: 儘管兵力懸殊，劉備和孫權最後還是打贏了這場戰役。

sentences.english: Wu and Liu Bei's allied forces win in this way.
sentences.chinese: 東吳和劉備的聯軍就這樣勝利了。

sentences.english: One was Liu Bei, a descendent of Liu Sheng, Prince Jin of Zhongshan during the Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 劉備，是漢朝中山靖王劉勝的後代。

sentences.english: Hastily dismounting, Liu Bei asked what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 匆忙下馬，劉備問發生了什麼事。

sentences.english: I think he made more of a contribution to history than Liu Bei did.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲曹操對歷史的貢獻比劉備要多。

sentences.english: I don't like Liu Bei and friends.
Zhao Yun and Liu Bei's special relationship allowed him to do things others did not dare to do.
sentences.chinese: 趙雲和劉備的特殊關係，使他敢做別人不敢做的事。

sentences.english: Then Liu Bei told them of the plan to strive for tranquillity.
sentences.chinese: 然後劉備告訴他們的計畫，以爭取平靜。

sentences.english: First of all, as a fierce and ambitious generation of Liu Bei, does not have military talent.
sentences.chinese: 首先，作爲一代梟雄的劉備，並不具有軍事上的才華。

sentences.english: Liu Biao's wife Cai and her brother had long wished to Xiangyang to meet some officials.
sentences.chinese: 劉表的夫人蔡氏和其兄蔡瑁早有殺害劉備之心。

sentences.english: So Lü invited both Liu Bei and Ji Ling to a bqnqet.
sentences.chinese: 於是，呂布讓人把劉備和紀靈同時請來赴宴。

definition: Guan Yu (-219), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, fearsome fighter famous for virtue and loyalty/posthumously worshipped and identified with the guardian Bodhisattva Sangharama

Zhuge Liang (181-234), military leader and prime minister of Shu Han 蜀漢|蜀汉 during the Three Kingdoms period/the main hero of the fictional Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义, where he is portrayed as a sage and military genius/mastermind
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
Han Xin (-196 BC), famous general of first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1]
Zhao Yun (-229), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
Lü Bu (-198), general and warlord
Zhang Fei (168-221), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, famous as fearsome fighter and lover of wine
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
Huang Zhong (-220), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, portrayed as an old fighter
Liu Bang (256 or 247-195 BC), bandit leader who became first Han emperor Han Gaozu 漢高祖|汉高祖 (reigned 202-195 BC)
high-ranking military officer
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot

Di Renjie (607-700), Tang dynasty politician, prime minister under Wu Zetian, subsequently hero of legends/master sleuth Judge Dee, aka Chinese Sherlock Holmes, in novel Three murder cases solved by Judge Dee 狄公案[Di2 gong1 an4] translated by Dutch sinologist R.H. van Gulik 高羅珮|高罗佩[Gao1 Luo2 pei4]
Sichuan/the state of Shu in Sichuan at different periods/the Shu Han dynasty (214-263) of Liu Bei 劉備|刘备 during the Three Kingdoms
stratagem/scheme
